t: Lamentations 1
Jerusalem in Affliction
How*pn lonely sits the city That*ild was*i full of people! How*ild like a widow is she, Who*ld was*i great among the nations! The*ld princess among the provinces Has*ld become a slave!

She*ln weeps bitterly in the night, Her*ld tears are*i on her cheeks; Among*ld all her lovers She*ld has none to comfort her.*i All*ld her friends have dealt treacherously with her; They*ld have become her enemies.
Judah*ln has gone into captivity, Under*ld affliction and hard servitude; She*ld dwells among the nations, She*ld finds no rest; All*ld her persecutors overtake her in dire straits.
The*ln roads to Zion mourn Because*ld no one comes to the set feasts. All*ld her gates are desolate; Her*ld priests sigh, Her*ld virgins are afflicted, And*ld she is*i in bitterness.

Her*ln adversaries have become the master, Her*ld enemies prosper; For*ld the Lord*s has afflicted her Because*ld of the multitude of her transgressions. Her*ld children have gone into captivity before the enemy.
And*ln from the daughter of Zion All*ld her splendor has departed. Her*ld princes have become like deer That*ild find no pasture, That*ld flee without strength Before*ld the pursuer.

In*ln the days of her affliction and roaming, Jerusalem*ld remembers all her pleasant things That*ld she had in the days of old. When*ld her people fell into the hand of the enemy, With*ld no one to help her, The*ld adversaries saw her And*ild mocked at her downfall.
Jerusalem*ln has sinned gravely, Therefore*ld she has become vile. All*ld who honored her despise her Because*ld they have seen her nakedness; Yes,*ld she sighs and turns away.

Her*ln uncleanness is*i in her skirts; She*ld did not consider her destiny; Therefore*ld her collapse was awesome; She*ld had no comforter. “O*ld Lord,*s behold my affliction, For*ld the*i enemy is exalted!”
The*ln adversary has spread his hand Over*ld all her pleasant things; For*ld she has seen the nations enter her sanctuary, Those*ld whom You commanded Not*ld to enter Your assembly.
All*ln her people sigh, They*ld seek bread; They*ld have given their valuables for food to restore life. “See,*ld O Lord,*s and consider, For*ld I am scorned.”

“Is*iln it*i nothing to you, all you who pass by? Behold*ld and see If*ld there is any sorrow like my sorrow, Which*ld has been brought on me, Which*ld the Lord*s has inflicted In*ld the day of His fierce anger.
“From*ln above He has sent fire into my bones, And*ld it overpowered them; He*ld has spread a net for my feet And*ld turned me back; He*ld has made me desolate And*ild faint all the day.

“The*ln yoke of my transgressions was bound; They*ld were woven together by His hands, And*ild thrust upon my neck. He*ld made my strength fail; The*ld Lord delivered me into the hands of those*i whom*i I am not able to withstand.

“The*ln Lord has trampled underfoot all my mighty men*i in my midst; He*ld has called an assembly against me To*ld crush my young men; The*ld Lord trampled as*i in a winepress The*ld virgin daughter of Judah.

“For*ln these things*i I weep; My*ld eye, my eye overflows with water; Because*ld the comforter, who should restore my life, Is*ld far from me. My*ld children are desolate Because*ld the enemy prevailed.”

Zion*ln spreads out her hands, But*ild no one comforts her; The*ld Lord*s has commanded concerning Jacob That*ild those around him become*i his adversaries; Jerusalem*ld has become an unclean thing among them.
“The*ln Lord*s is righteous, For*ld I rebelled against His commandment. Hear*ld now, all peoples, And*ld behold my sorrow; My*ld virgins and my young men Have*ld gone into captivity.
“I*ln called for my lovers, But*ild they deceived me; My*ld priests and my elders Breathed*ld their last in the city, While*ld they sought food To*ld restore their life.

“See,*ln O Lord,*s that I am*i in distress; My*ld soul is troubled; My*ld heart is overturned within me, For*ld I have been very rebellious. Outside*ld the sword bereaves, At*ld home it*i is*i like death.

“They*ln have heard that I sigh, But*ild no one comforts me. All*ld my enemies have heard of my trouble; They*ld are glad that You have done it.*i Bring*ld on the day You have announced, That*ld they may become like me.
“Let*ln all their wickedness come before You, And*ld do to them as You have done to me For*ld all my transgressions; For*ld my sighs are*i many, And*ld my heart is*i faint.”
Lamentations 2
God’s Anger with Jerusalem

How*pn the Lord has covered the daughter of Zion With*ld a cloud in His anger! He*ld cast down from heaven to the earth The*ld beauty of Israel, And*ld did not remember His footstool In*ld the day of His anger.

The*ln Lord has swallowed up and has not pitied All*ld the dwelling places of Jacob. He*ld has thrown down in His wrath The*ld strongholds of the daughter of Judah; He*ld has brought them*i down to the ground; He*ld has profaned the kingdom and its princes.
He*ln has cut off in fierce anger Every*ld horn of Israel; He*ld has drawn back His right hand From*ld before the enemy. He*ld has blazed against Jacob like a flaming fire Devouring*ld all around.

Standing*ln like an enemy, He has bent His bow; With*ld His right hand, like an adversary, He*ld has slain all who*i were*i pleasing to His eye; On*ld the tent of the daughter of Zion, He*ld has poured out His fury like fire.

The*ln Lord was like an enemy. He*ld has swallowed up Israel, He*ld has swallowed up all her palaces; He*ld has destroyed her strongholds, And*ld has increased mourning and lamentation In*ld the daughter of Judah.

He*ln has done violence to His tabernacle, As*ild if*i it*i were*i a garden; He*ld has destroyed His place of assembly; The*ld Lord*s has caused The*ld appointed feasts and Sabbaths to be forgotten in Zion. In*ld His burning indignation He has spurned the king and the priest.

The*ln Lord has spurned His altar, He*ld has abandoned His sanctuary; He*ld has given up the walls of her palaces Into*ld the hand of the enemy. They*ld have made a noise in the house of the Lord*s As*ld on the day of a set feast.

The*ln Lord*s has purposed to destroy The*ld wall of the daughter of Zion. He*ld has stretched out a line; He*ld has not withdrawn His hand from destroying; Therefore*ld He has caused the rampart and wall to lament; They*ld languished together.

Her*ln gates have sunk into the ground; He*ld has destroyed and broken her bars. Her*ld king and her princes are*i among the nations; The*ld Law is*i no more,*i And*ld her prophets find no vision from the Lord.*s

The*ln elders of the daughter of Zion Sit*ld on the ground and*i keep silence; They*ld throw dust on their heads And*ld gird themselves with sackcloth. The*ld virgins of Jerusalem Bow*ld their heads to the ground.

My*ln eyes fail with tears, My*ld heart is troubled; My*ld bile is poured on the ground Because*ld of the destruction of the daughter of my people, Because*ld the children and the infants Faint*ld in the streets of the city.
They*ln say to their mothers, “Where*ld is*i grain and wine?” As*ld they swoon like the wounded In*ld the streets of the city, As*ld their life is poured out In*ld their mothers’ bosom.

How*ln shall I console you? To*ld what shall I liken you, O*ld daughter of Jerusalem? What*ld shall I compare with you, that I may comfort you, O*ld virgin daughter of Zion? For*ld your ruin is*i spread wide as the sea; Who*ld can heal you?

Your*ln prophets have seen for you False*ld and deceptive visions; They*ld have not uncovered your iniquity, To*ld bring back your captives, But*ld have envisioned for you false prophecies and delusions.

All*ln who pass by clap their*i hands at you; They*ld hiss and shake their heads At*ld the daughter of Jerusalem: “Is*ild this the city that is called ‘The*ld perfection of beauty, The*ld joy of the whole earth’?”

All*ln your enemies have opened their mouth against you; They*ld hiss and gnash their*i teeth. They*ld say, “We have swallowed her*i up! Surely*ld this is*i the day we have waited for; We*ld have found it,*i we have seen it!”*i

The*ln Lord*s has done what He purposed; He*ld has fulfilled His word Which*ld He commanded in days of old. He*ld has thrown down and has not pitied, And*ld He has caused an enemy to rejoice over you; He*ld has exalted the horn of your adversaries.
Their*ln heart cried out to the Lord, “O*ld wall of the daughter of Zion, Let*ld tears run down like a river day and night; Give*ld yourself no relief; Give*ld your eyes no rest.

“Arise,*ln cry out in the night, At*ld the beginning of the watches; Pour*ld out your heart like water before the face of the Lord. Lift*ld your hands toward Him For*ld the life of your young children, Who*ld faint from hunger at the head of every street.”

“See,*ln O Lord,*s and consider! To*ld whom have You done this? Should*ld the women eat their offspring, The*ld children they have cuddled? Should*ld the priest and prophet be slain In*ld the sanctuary of the Lord?

“Young*ln and old lie On*ld the ground in the streets; My*ld virgins and my young men Have*ld fallen by the sword; You*ld have slain them*i in the day of Your anger, You*ld have slaughtered and*i not pitied.

“You*ln have invited as to a feast day The*ld terrors that surround me. In*ld the day of the Lord’s*s anger There*ld was no refugee or survivor. Those*ld whom I have borne and brought up My*ld enemies have destroyed.”
Lamentations 3
The Prophet’s Anguish and Hope
I*pn am*i the man who*i has seen affliction by the rod of His wrath.
He*ld has led me and made me*i walk In*ild darkness and not in*i light.
Surely*ld He has turned His hand against me Time*ld and time again throughout the day.
He*ln has aged my flesh and my skin, And*ld broken my bones.
He*ld has besieged me And*ld surrounded me*i with bitterness and woe.
He*ld has set me in dark places Like*ld the dead of long ago.
He*ln has hedged me in so that I cannot get out; He*ld has made my chain heavy.
Even*ld when I cry and shout, He*ld shuts out my prayer.
He*ld has blocked my ways with hewn stone; He*ld has made my paths crooked.
He*ln has*i been*i to me a bear lying in wait, Like*ild a lion in ambush.
He*ld has turned aside my ways and torn me in pieces; He*ld has made me desolate.
He*ld has bent His bow And*ld set me up as a target for the arrow.
He*ln has caused the arrows of His quiver To*ld pierce my loins.
I*ld have become the ridicule of all my people— Their*ld taunting song all the day.
He*ld has filled me with bitterness, He*ld has made me drink wormwood.
He*ln has also broken my teeth with gravel, And*ld covered me with ashes.
You*ld have moved my soul far from peace; I*ld have forgotten prosperity.
And*ld I said, “My strength and my hope Have*ld perished from the Lord.”*s
Remember*ln my affliction and roaming, The*ld wormwood and the gall.
My*ld soul still remembers And*ld sinks within me.
This*ld I recall to my mind, Therefore*ld I have hope.
Through*iln the Lord’s*s mercies we are not consumed, Because*ld His compassions fail not.
They*ild are*i new every morning; Great*ld is*i Your faithfulness.
“The*ld Lord*s is*i my portion,” says my soul, “Therefore*ld I hope in Him!”
The*ln Lord*s is*i good to those who wait for Him, To*ld the soul who*i seeks Him.
It*ild is*i good that one*i should hope and wait quietly For*ld the salvation of the Lord.*s
It*ild is*i good for a man to bear The*ld yoke in his youth.
Let*ln him sit alone and keep silent, Because*ld God*i has laid it*i on him;
Let*ld him put his mouth in the dust— There*ld may yet be hope.
Let*ld him give his*i cheek to the one who strikes him, And*ild be full of reproach.
For*ln the Lord will not cast off forever.
Though*ld He causes grief, Yet*ld He will show compassion According*ld to the multitude of His mercies.
For*ld He does not afflict willingly, Nor*ld grieve the children of men.
To*ln crush under one’s feet All*ld the prisoners of the earth,
To*ld turn aside the justice due*i a man Before*ld the face of the Most High,
Or*ld subvert a man in his cause— The*ld Lord does not approve.
Who*ln is*i he who*i speaks and it comes to pass, When*ild the Lord has not commanded it?*i
Is*ild it*i not from the mouth of the Most High That*ld woe and well-being proceed?
Why*ld should a living man complain, A*ld man for the punishment of his sins?
Let*ln us search out and examine our ways, And*ld turn back to the Lord;*s
Let*ld us lift our hearts and hands To*ld God in heaven.
We*ld have transgressed and rebelled; You*ld have not pardoned.
You*ln have covered Yourself*i with anger And*ld pursued us; You*ld have slain and*i not pitied.
You*ld have covered Yourself with a cloud, That*ld prayer should not pass through.
You*ld have made us an offscouring and refuse In*ld the midst of the peoples.
All*ln our enemies Have*ld opened their mouths against us.
Fear*ld and a snare have come upon us, Desolation*ld and destruction.
My*ld eyes overflow with rivers of water For*ld the destruction of the daughter of my people.
My*ln eyes flow and do not cease, Without*ld interruption,
Till*ld the Lord*s from heaven Looks*ld down and sees.
My*ld eyes bring suffering to my soul Because*ld of all the daughters of my city.
My*ln enemies without cause Hunted*ld me down like a bird.
They*ld silenced my life in the pit And*ld threw stones at me.
The*ld waters flowed over my head; I*ld said, “I am cut off!”
I*ln called on Your name, O Lord,*s From*ld the lowest pit.
You*ld have heard my voice: “Do*ld not hide Your ear From*ld my sighing, from my cry for help.”
You*ld drew near on the day I called on You, And*ld said, “Do not fear!”
O*ln Lord, You have pleaded the case for my soul; You*ld have redeemed my life.
O*ld Lord,*s You have seen how*i I am wronged; Judge*ld my case.
You*ld have seen all their vengeance, All*ld their schemes against me.
You*ln have heard their reproach, O Lord,*s All*ld their schemes against me,
The*ld lips of my enemies And*ld their whispering against me all the day.
Look*ld at their sitting down and their rising up; I*ld am*i their taunting song.
Repay*ln them, O Lord,*s According*ld to the work of their hands.
Give*ld them a veiled heart; Your*ld curse be*i upon them!
In*ld Your anger, Pursue*ld and destroy them From*ld under the heavens of the Lord.*s
Lamentations 4
The Degradation of Zion
How*pn the gold has become dim! How*ild changed the fine gold! The*ld stones of the sanctuary are scattered At*ld the head of every street.
The*ln precious sons of Zion, Valuable*ld as fine gold, How*ld they are regarded as clay pots, The*ld work of the hands of the potter!
Even*ln the jackals present their breasts To*ld nurse their young; But*ild the daughter of my people is*i cruel, Like*ld ostriches in the wilderness.
The*ln tongue of the infant clings To*ld the roof of its mouth for thirst; The*ld young children ask for bread, But*ild no one breaks it*i for them.
Those*ln who ate delicacies Are*ld desolate in the streets; Those*ld who were brought up in scarlet Embrace*ld ash heaps.
The*ln punishment of the iniquity of the daughter of my people Is*ld greater than the punishment of the sin of Sodom, Which*ld was overthrown in a moment, With*ld no hand to help her!
Her*ln Nazirites were brighter than snow And*ld whiter than milk; They*ld were more ruddy in body than rubies, Like*ild sapphire in their appearance.
Now*iln their appearance is blacker than soot; They*ld go unrecognized in the streets; Their*ld skin clings to their bones, It*ld has become as dry as wood.
Those*iln slain by the sword are better off Than*ld those*i who die of hunger; For*ld these pine away, Stricken*ld for*i lack*i of the fruits of the field.
The*ln hands of the compassionate women Have*ld cooked their own children; They*ld became food for them In*ld the destruction of the daughter of my people.
The*ln Lord*s has fulfilled His fury, He*ld has poured out His fierce anger. He*ld kindled a fire in Zion, And*ld it has devoured its foundations.
The*ln kings of the earth, And*ld all inhabitants of the world, Would*ld not have believed That*ld the adversary and the enemy Could*ld enter the gates of Jerusalem—
Because*ln of the sins of her prophets And*ild the iniquities of her priests, Who*ld shed in her midst The*ld blood of the just.
They*ln wandered blind in the streets; They*ld have defiled themselves with blood, So*ld that no one would touch their garments.
They*ln cried out to them, “Go*ld away, unclean! Go*ld away, go away, Do*ld not touch us!” When*ld they fled and wandered, Those*ild among the nations said, “They*ld shall no longer dwell here.”*i
The*ln face of the Lord*s scattered them; He*ld no longer regards them. The*ild people*i do not respect the priests Nor*ld show favor to the elders.
Still*ln our eyes failed us, Watching*ild vainly for our help; In*ld our watching we watched For*ld a nation that*i could not save us.*i
They*ln tracked our steps So*ld that we could not walk in our streets. Our*ld end was near; Our*ld days were over, For*ld our end had come.
Our*ln pursuers were swifter Than*ld the eagles of the heavens. They*ld pursued us on the mountains And*ld lay in wait for us in the wilderness.
The*ln breath of our nostrils, the anointed of the Lord,*s Was*ld caught in their pits, Of*ld whom we said, “Under his shadow We*ld shall live among the nations.”
Rejoice*ln and be glad, O daughter of Edom, You*ild who dwell in the land of Uz! The*ld cup shall also pass over to you And*ld you shall become drunk and make yourself naked.

The*iln punishment*i of*i your iniquity is accomplished, O*ld daughter of Zion; He*ld will no longer send you into captivity. He*ld will punish your iniquity, O*ld daughter of Edom; He*ld will uncover your sins!
Lamentations 5
A Prayer for Restoration
Remember,*pn O Lord,*s what has come upon us; Look,*ld and behold our reproach!
Our*ld inheritance has been turned over to aliens, And*ld our houses to foreigners.
We*ld have become orphans and waifs, Our*ld mothers are*i like widows.
We*ln pay for the water we drink, And*ld our wood comes at a price.
They*ild pursue at our heels; We*ld labor and*i have no rest.
We*ld have given our hand to*i the Egyptians And*ild the Assyrians, to be satisfied with bread.
Our*ln fathers sinned and*i are*i no more, But*ld we bear their iniquities.
Servants*ld rule over us; There*ild is*i none to deliver us*i from their hand.
We*ld get our bread at*i the*i risk*i of our lives, Because*ld of the sword in the wilderness.
Our*ln skin is hot as an oven, Because*ld of the fever of famine.
They*ld ravished the women in Zion, The*ld maidens in the cities of Judah.
Princes*ld were hung up by their hands, And*ld elders were not respected.
Young*ld men ground at the millstones; Boys*ld staggered under loads*i of*i wood.
The*ld elders have ceased gathering*i at*i the gate, And*ld the young men from their music.
The*ln joy of our heart has ceased; Our*ld dance has turned into mourning.
The*ld crown has fallen from*i our head. Woe*ld to us, for we have sinned!
Because*ld of this our heart is faint; Because*ld of these things*i our eyes grow dim;
Because*ld of Mount Zion which is desolate, With*ld foxes walking about on it.
You,*ln O Lord,*s remain forever; Your*ld throne from generation to generation.
Why*ld do You forget us forever, And*ild forsake us for so long a time?
Turn*ld us back to You, O Lord,*s and we will be restored; Renew*ld our days as of old,
Unless*ld You have utterly rejected us, And*ild are very angry with us!
